result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber J Hopp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Amber J Hopp
Current: 431 1/2 B East Main St, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 10-16-2014)
Prior: 313 1/2 Main Street, Waupun, WI 53963 United States

Cases heard: 14CF221 & 14CF405, Defendant Amber J Hopp in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to counts 6&7 in 14CF221 and to 14CF405 as amended to misdemeanor bailjumping. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 yr. probation, conds: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. no contact T.D., $1,000 restitution in 14CF221 case, $443 costs on each count, maintain full-time work, school or doing an active search for work.  Defendant may petition Court in writing, after 2 years, for expunction of both cases, contingent upon successful completion of probation, no new law violations and costs and restitution paid in full. Jail credit - 7 days in 14CF405, 2 days in 14CF221. Ct. 5 in 14CF221 read in and dismissed. Amended Complaint in 14CF405 to be filed today.

Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared, made statement for defendant's non-appearance. Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.
with Affidavit for Search Warrant and Return of Search Warrant and Inventory filed by Deputy Christopher Weber, COSO

Defendant Amber J Hopp in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Riek requested a preliminary hearing be set.  Bond remains.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.
